thread.title: One volunteer so far for spot on City Council
thread.title_full: One volunteer so far for spot on City Council

title: One volunteer so far for spot on City Council
text: One volunteer so far for spot on City Council One volunteer so far for spot on City Council By Baker City Herald October 07, 2015 12:26 pm With just two days left to apply, only one person has volunteered to fill a vacancy on the Baker City Council. Margaret D. “Sandy” Lewis has applied to replace Ben Merrill, who resigned last month. The city is accepting applications until 10 a.m. on Friday. Lewis is a retired registered nurse who moved to Baker City in 2006. In a letter that accompanied her application, Lewis wrote that she would bring to the City Council “a positive and participatory attitude.” “This opportunity came at a time when I felt I could responsibly attend meetings and contribute to community discussion,” Lewis wrote. “I offer an interested, enthusiastic, involved citizenship.” The remaining six city councilors will appoint Merrill’s replacement. The appointed councilor will serve a term ending Dec. 31, 2016. To be eligible to serve as a councilor, a person must be a registered voter in Oregon and have lived within the city for 12 months immediately preceding the appointment. To apply, go to www.bakercity.com to download and complete the City Councilor application, and submit a letter of interest to Luke Yeaton at City Hall. Applications can be returned to: Attn: Luke Yeaton, 1655 First St., Baker City OR, 97814 More information is available by calling Yeaton at 541-524-2033 or by email at This e-mail address is being protected from spam bots, you need JavaScript enabled to view it
